title: Plans to Attract More Than US$ 3B in FDI
content: The Board of Investment (BOI) of Sri Lanka is aiming to attract US$ 3 billion in Foreign Direct Investments (FDI) into the country by 2026, and the organisation has finalised a strategic plan for the period of 2022-2026.Sri Lanka managed to surpass US$ 2 billion in FDI inflow in 2018 after the then Government decided to lease the Hambantota International Port to China.In 2019, the country only managed to attract US$ 1.19 billion as FDI and in 2020 the figure slipped to US$ 670 million as per the Central Bank Annual Report. The BOI has not submitted the figures of 2021 as of yet.The BOI aims to deliver 32% CAGR in FDI inflows over the next five years with US$ 3 billion to be recorded as inflows in 2026.To realise this inflow would necessitate building a committed FDI project pipeline circa five billion dollars, the strategic plan showed.
